alert.note: Alert for Kern; Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 5:35PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kern and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 730 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bakersfield, Arvin, Shafter, Tehachapi, Taft, Maricopa, Lamont, Weedpatch, Stallion Springs, Mettler, Golden Hills, Rosedale, Bodfish, Squirrel Mountain Valley, South Lake Cdp, Weldon, Dustin Acres, Frazier Park, Lake Isabella and Edison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
